headline: Wells Fargo Expects SCB to Decrease to 2.5% from 3.8% and Intends to Raise Dividend by 12.5% to $0.45
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, July 01, 2025--Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) today announced that it has completed the 2025 Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) stress test process. The Federal Reserve Board’s (FRB) calculations resulted in an expected stress capital buffer (SCB) for the Company below the minimum, and the Company therefore expects its SCB to decrease from 3.8% to the minimum of 2.5%, which represents a percentage amount of incremental capital the Company must hold above its minim

headline: Bank Stocks Near Record With Buyback, Dividend Boosts on Horizon

headline: Wells Fargo Raises 3Q Dividend, Decreases Stress Capital Buffer
summary: By Natalie Weger Wells Fargo said it would raise its third-quarter dividend by about 12.5%, to 45 cents a share. The new payout, equal to $1.80 a year, represents an annual yield of 0.02%...

headline: ‘Dark Pools’ Are Handling More Stock Trades. Wall Street Is Fighting Back.
summary: A trading platform called IntelligentCross has gotten under Wall Street’s skin.  In February, IntelligentCross handled nearly 3% of the nation’s stock trades.  With the backing of the industry self-regulator Finra, it has been asking the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to let it set national stock prices, like an exchange does.
